text.0: may dyaus the lord of lauded wealth and earth stand by the man who offers sacrifice.
text.1: and may the aśvins both the gods strengthen the worshipper with bliss.
text.2: as such we honour you mitra and varuṇa with hasty zeal most blest you who sustain the folk.
text.3: so may we through your friendship for the worshipper subdue the fiends.
text.4: and when we seek to win your love and friendship weẉho have precious wealth in our possession.
text.5: or when the worshipper augments his riches let not his treasures be shut up.
text.6: that other asura too was born of heaven thou art o varuṇa the king of all men.
text.7: the chariots lord was well content forbearing to anger death by sin so great.
text.8: this sin hath sakaputa here committed heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth.
text.9: when the steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.
text.10: your mother aditi ye wise was purified with water even as earth is purified from heaven.
text.11: show love and kindness here below wash her in rays of heavenly light.
text.12: ye twain have seated you as lords of wealth as one who mounts a car to him who sits upon the pole upon the wood.
text.13: these our disheartened tribes nrmedhas saved from woe sumedhas saved from woe.
